trans-unit.source: How to: Create My First Claims-Aware ASP.NET Application Using ACS
trans-unit.target: How to: Create My First Claims-Aware ASP.NET Application Using ACS

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Create My First Claims-Aware ASP.NET Application Using ACS
trans-unit.target: How to: Create My First Claims-Aware ASP.NET Application Using ACS

trans-unit.source: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.
trans-unit.target: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.

trans-unit.source: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.
trans-unit.target: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.

trans-unit.source: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.

trans-unit.source: Until you perform migration, this tutorial can be completed using another identity provider, such as Facebook.
trans-unit.target: Until you perform migration, this tutorial can be completed using another identity provider, such as Facebook.

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the scenario of integrating <token>secondref_acs</token> with an ASP.NET relying party application.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the scenario of integrating <token>secondref_acs</token> with an ASP.NET relying party application.

trans-unit.source: By integrating your web application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, you factor the features of authentication and authorization out of your code.
trans-unit.target: By integrating your web application with <token>secondref_acs</token>, you factor the features of authentication and authorization out of your code.

trans-unit.source: In other words, <token>secondref_acs</token> provides the mechanism for authenticating and authorizing users to your web application.
trans-unit.target: In other words, <token>secondref_acs</token> provides the mechanism for authenticating and authorizing users to your web application.

trans-unit.source: In this practice scenario, <token>secondref_acs</token> authenticates users with a Google identity into a test ASP.NET relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In this practice scenario, <token>secondref_acs</token> authenticates users with a Google identity into a test ASP.NET relying party application.

trans-unit.source: Steps for Integrating ACS with an ASP.NET Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Steps for Integrating ACS with an ASP.NET Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: Before performing the following steps, make sure that your system meets all of the .NET framework and platform requirements that are summarized in <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Prerequisites</link>.
trans-unit.target: Before performing the following steps, make sure that your system meets all of the .NET framework and platform requirements that are summarized in <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Prerequisites</link>.

trans-unit.source: To integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with an ASP.NET relying party application, complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with an ASP.NET relying party application, complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Create an Access Control Namespace
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Create an Access Control Namespace

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions about how to create an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create an Access Control Namespace</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions about how to create an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create an Access Control Namespace</link>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Launch the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Launch the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal allows you to configure your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> by adding identity providers, configuring relying party applications, defining rules and groups of rules, and establishing the credentials that your relying party application trusts.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal allows you to configure your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> by adding identity providers, configuring relying party applications, defining rules and groups of rules, and establishing the credentials that your relying party application trusts.

trans-unit.source: To launch the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To launch the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Add Identity Providers
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Add Identity Providers

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to add identity providers to use with your relying party application for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to add identity providers to use with your relying party application for authentication.

trans-unit.source: For more information about identity providers, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Identity Providers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about identity providers, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Identity Providers</link>.

trans-unit.source: To add identity providers
trans-unit.target: To add identity providers

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Identity Providers</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Identity Providers</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Identity Providers</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Identity Providers</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Identity Providers</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>, select <ui>Google</ui> as the identity provider, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Identity Providers</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>, select <ui>Google</ui> as the identity provider, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Add Google Identity Provider</ui> page prompts you to enter login link text (the default is <ui>Google</ui>) and an image URL.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Add Google Identity Provider</ui> page prompts you to enter login link text (the default is <ui>Google</ui>) and an image URL.

trans-unit.source: This URL points to a file of an image that can be used as the login link for this identity provider.
trans-unit.target: This URL points to a file of an image that can be used as the login link for this identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Editing these fields is optional.
trans-unit.target: Editing these fields is optional.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, do not edit them, click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, do not edit them, click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 4 – Add a Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Step 4 – Add a Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to add and configure a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to add and configure a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For more information about relying party applications, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about relying party applications, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: To set up a relying party application
trans-unit.target: To set up a relying party application

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Relying Party Application</ui> page, do the following:
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Relying Party Application</ui> page, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Name</ui>, type the name of the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Name</ui>, type the name of the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, type <userInput>TestApp</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, type <userInput>TestApp</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Mode</ui>, select <ui>Enter settings manually</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Mode</ui>, select <ui>Enter settings manually</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Realm</ui>, type the URI that the security token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> applies to.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Realm</ui>, type the URI that the security token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> applies to.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, type <userInput>http://localhost:7777/</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, type <userInput>http://localhost:7777/</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Return URL</ui>, type the URL that <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the security token to.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Return URL</ui>, type the URL that <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the security token to.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, type <userInput>http://localhost:7777/</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, type <userInput>http://localhost:7777/</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Error URL (optional)</ui>, enter the URL that <token>secondref_acs</token> can post to if an error occurs during sign in.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Error URL (optional)</ui>, enter the URL that <token>secondref_acs</token> can post to if an error occurs during sign in.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, leave this field blank.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, leave this field blank.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Token format</ui>, select a token format for <token>secondref_acs</token> to use when issuing security tokens to this relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Token format</ui>, select a token format for <token>secondref_acs</token> to use when issuing security tokens to this relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, select <ui>SAML 2.0</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, select <ui>SAML 2.0</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about tokens and token formats, see <link xlink:href="5fd7e09f-0c5b-4571-943e-c743ee0bac9d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Token Formats Supported in ACS </link> and “Token Format” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about tokens and token formats, see <link xlink:href="5fd7e09f-0c5b-4571-943e-c743ee0bac9d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Token Formats Supported in ACS </link> and “Token Format” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Token encryption policy</ui>, select an encryption policy for tokens issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> for this relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Token encryption policy</ui>, select an encryption policy for tokens issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> for this relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, accept the default value of <ui>None</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, accept the default value of <ui>None</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about token encryption policy, see “Token Encryption Policy” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about token encryption policy, see “Token Encryption Policy” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Token lifetime (secs)</ui>, specify the amount of time for a security token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> to remain valid.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Token lifetime (secs)</ui>, specify the amount of time for a security token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> to remain valid.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, accept the default value of <ui>600</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, accept the default value of <ui>600</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see “Token Lifetime” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see “Token Lifetime” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Identity providers</ui>, select the identity providers to use with this relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Identity providers</ui>, select the identity providers to use with this relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, accept the checked defaults (<ui>Google</ui> and <ui><token>windows_live_id</token></ui>).
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, accept the checked defaults (<ui>Google</ui> and <ui><token>windows_live_id</token></ui>).

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Rule groups</ui>, select the rule groups for this relying party application to use when processing claims.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Rule groups</ui>, select the rule groups for this relying party application to use when processing claims.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, accept <ui>Create New Rule Group</ui> that is checked by default.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, accept <ui>Create New Rule Group</ui> that is checked by default.

trans-unit.source: For more information about rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Token Signing Settings</ui> section, select whether to sign SAML tokens with the certificate for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> or with a custom certificate specific to this application.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Token Signing Settings</ui> section, select whether to sign SAML tokens with the certificate for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> or with a custom certificate specific to this application.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, accept the default value of <ui>Use service namespace certificate (standard)</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, accept the default value of <ui>Use service namespace certificate (standard)</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about token signing, see “Token Signing” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about token signing, see “Token Signing” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 - Create Rules
trans-unit.target: Step 5 - Create Rules

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to define rules that determine how claims are passed from identity providers to your relying party application.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to define rules that determine how claims are passed from identity providers to your relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For more information about rules and rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about rules and rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: To create rules
trans-unit.target: To create rules

trans-unit.source: On the <ui><token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal Home</ui> page, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui><token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal Home</ui> page, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: On <ui>Rule Groups</ui> page, click <ui>Default Rule Group for TestApp</ui> (since you named your relying party application <userInput>TestApp</userInput>).
trans-unit.target: On <ui>Rule Groups</ui> page, click <ui>Default Rule Group for TestApp</ui> (since you named your relying party application <userInput>TestApp</userInput>).

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click <ui>Generate</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click <ui>Generate</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Generate Rules: Default Rule Group for TestApp</ui> page, accept the identity providers selected by default (in this exercise, <ui>Google</ui> and <ui><token>windows_live_id</token></ui>), and then click the <ui>Generate</ui> button.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Generate Rules: Default Rule Group for TestApp</ui> page, accept the identity providers selected by default (in this exercise, <ui>Google</ui> and <ui><token>windows_live_id</token></ui>), and then click the <ui>Generate</ui> button.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 6 - Review the Application Integration Information
trans-unit.target: Step 6 - Review the Application Integration Information

trans-unit.source: You can find all of the information and code necessary to modify your relying party application to work with <token>secondref_acs</token> on the <ui>Application Integration</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can find all of the information and code necessary to modify your relying party application to work with <token>secondref_acs</token> on the <ui>Application Integration</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To review the application integration information
trans-unit.target: To review the application integration information

trans-unit.source: On the <ui><token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal Home</ui> page, click <ui>Application Integration</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Application Integration</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui><token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal Home</ui> page, click <ui>Application Integration</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Application Integration</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> URIs that are displayed on the <ui>Application Integration</ui> page are unique to your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> URIs that are displayed on the <ui>Application Integration</ui> page are unique to your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, it is recommended that you keep this page open in order to perform the remaining steps quickly.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, it is recommended that you keep this page open in order to perform the remaining steps quickly.

trans-unit.source: Step 7 - Create an ASP.NET Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Step 7 - Create an ASP.NET Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to create an ASP.Net Relying Party application that you want to eventually integrate with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to create an ASP.Net Relying Party application that you want to eventually integrate with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: To create an ASP.NET relying party application
trans-unit.target: To create an ASP.NET relying party application

trans-unit.source:
To run Visual Studio 2010, click Start, click Run, type the following text, and then press Enter:

devenv.exe
trans-unit.target:
To run Visual Studio 2010, click Start, click Run, type the following text, and then press Enter:

devenv.exe

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, click <ui>File</ui>, and then click <ui>New Project</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, click <ui>File</ui>, and then click <ui>New Project</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>New Project</ui> window, select either the <ui>Visual Basic</ui> or the <ui>Visual C#</ui> template, and then select <ui>ASP.NET MVC 2 Web Application</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>New Project</ui> window, select either the <ui>Visual Basic</ui> or the <ui>Visual C#</ui> template, and then select <ui>ASP.NET MVC 2 Web Application</ui>.

trans-unit.source:
In Name, type the following text, and then click OK:

 TestApp
trans-unit.target:
In Name, type the following text, and then click OK:

 TestApp

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Create Unit Test Project</ui>, select <ui>No, do not create a unit test project</ui>, and then click <ui>OK</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Create Unit Test Project</ui>, select <ui>No, do not create a unit test project</ui>, and then click <ui>OK</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, right-click <ui>TestApp</ui>, and then select <ui>Properties</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, right-click <ui>TestApp</ui>, and then select <ui>Properties</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>TestApp properties</ui> window, select the <ui>Web</ui> tab, under <ui>Use Visual Studio Development Server</ui> click <ui>Specific port</ui>, and then change the value to <userInput>7777</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>TestApp properties</ui> window, select the <ui>Web</ui> tab, under <ui>Use Visual Studio Development Server</ui> click <ui>Specific port</ui>, and then change the value to <userInput>7777</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: To run and debug the application you just created, press F5.
trans-unit.target: To run and debug the application you just created, press F5.

trans-unit.source: If no errors were found, your browser renders an empty MVC project.
trans-unit.target: If no errors were found, your browser renders an empty MVC project.

trans-unit.source: Keep Visual Studio 2010 open in order to complete the next step.
trans-unit.target: Keep Visual Studio 2010 open in order to complete the next step.

trans-unit.source: Step 8 – Configure Trust Between ACS and Your ASP.NET Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Step 8 – Configure Trust Between ACS and Your ASP.NET Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with the ASP.NET Relying Party application that you created in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with the ASP.NET Relying Party application that you created in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: To configure trust between the ASP.NET relying party application and ACS
trans-unit.target: To configure trust between the ASP.NET relying party application and ACS

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2010, in <ui>Solution Explorer</ui> for TestApp, right-click <ui>TestApp</ui>, and then select <ui>Add STS Reference</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2010, in <ui>Solution Explorer</ui> for TestApp, right-click <ui>TestApp</ui>, and then select <ui>Add STS Reference</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Federation Utility</ui> wizard, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Federation Utility</ui> wizard, do the following:

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Welcome to the Federation Utility Wizard</ui> page, in <ui>Application URI</ui>, enter the application URI and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Welcome to the Federation Utility Wizard</ui> page, in <ui>Application URI</ui>, enter the application URI and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In this demo, the application URI is <userInput>http://localhost:7777/</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In this demo, the application URI is <userInput>http://localhost:7777/</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: The trailing slash is important because it matches the value you entered in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal for your relying party application.
trans-unit.target: The trailing slash is important because it matches the value you entered in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal for your relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="4b2fcff5-d518-4a15-9190-313c49980d71#BKMK_5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 4 – Add a Relying Party Application</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="4b2fcff5-d518-4a15-9190-313c49980d71#BKMK_5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 4 – Add a Relying Party Application</link>.

trans-unit.source: A warning pops up: <ui>ID 1007: The Application is not hosted on a secure https connection. Do you wish to continue?</ui> For this demo, click <ui>Yes</ui>.
trans-unit.target: A warning pops up: <ui>ID 1007: The Application is not hosted on a secure https connection. Do you wish to continue?</ui> For this demo, click <ui>Yes</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In a production environment, this warning about using SSL is valid and should not be dismissed.
trans-unit.target: In a production environment, this warning about using SSL is valid and should not be dismissed.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Security Token Service</ui> page, select <ui>Use Existing STS</ui>, enter the WS-Federation Metadata URL published by <token>secondref_acs</token>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Security Token Service</ui> page, select <ui>Use Existing STS</ui>, enter the WS-Federation Metadata URL published by <token>secondref_acs</token>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: You can find the value of the WS-Federation Metadata URL on the <ui>Application Integration</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can find the value of the WS-Federation Metadata URL on the <ui>Application Integration</ui> page of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="4b2fcff5-d518-4a15-9190-313c49980d71#BKMK_7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 6 - Review the Application Integration Information</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="4b2fcff5-d518-4a15-9190-313c49980d71#BKMK_7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 6 - Review the Application Integration Information</link>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>STS signing certificate chain validation error</ui> page, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>STS signing certificate chain validation error</ui> page, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Security token encryption</ui> page, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Security token encryption</ui> page, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Offered claims</ui> page, click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Offered claims</ui> page, click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Summary</ui> page, click <ui>Finish</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Summary</ui> page, click <ui>Finish</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Once you successfully finish running the Federation Utility wizard, it adds a reference to the Microsoft.IdentityModel.dll assembly and writes values to your Web.config file that configures the Windows Identity Foundation in your ASP.NET MVC 2 Web Application (TestApp).
trans-unit.target: Once you successfully finish running the Federation Utility wizard, it adds a reference to the Microsoft.IdentityModel.dll assembly and writes values to your Web.config file that configures the Windows Identity Foundation in your ASP.NET MVC 2 Web Application (TestApp).

trans-unit.source: Open Web.config and locate the main system.web element.
trans-unit.target: Open Web.config and locate the main system.web element.

trans-unit.source: It might look like the following:
trans-unit.target: It might look like the following:

trans-unit.source: Step 9 – Test the Integration Between ACS and Your ASP.NET Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Step 9 – Test the Integration Between ACS and Your ASP.NET Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: This section describes how you can test the integration between your relying party application and <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how you can test the integration between your relying party application and <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: To test the integration between the ASP.NET relying party application and ACS
trans-unit.target: To test the integration between the ASP.NET relying party application and ACS

trans-unit.source: Keeping Visual Studio 2010 open, press F5 to start debugging your ASP.NET relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Keeping Visual Studio 2010 open, press F5 to start debugging your ASP.NET relying party application.

trans-unit.source: If no errors are found, instead of opening the default MVC application, your browser is redirected to a <ui>Home Realm Discovery</ui> page hosted by <token>secondref_acs</token> that asks you to choose an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: If no errors are found, instead of opening the default MVC application, your browser is redirected to a <ui>Home Realm Discovery</ui> page hosted by <token>secondref_acs</token> that asks you to choose an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Google</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Google</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The browser then loads the Google logon page.
trans-unit.target: The browser then loads the Google logon page.

trans-unit.source: Enter your test Google credentials, and accept the consent UI shown on the Google website.
trans-unit.target: Enter your test Google credentials, and accept the consent UI shown on the Google website.

trans-unit.source: The browser then posts back to <token>secondref_acs</token>, <token>secondref_acs</token> issues a token, and posts that token to your MVC site.
trans-unit.target: The browser then posts back to <token>secondref_acs</token>, <token>secondref_acs</token> issues a token, and posts that token to your MVC site.
